title: America First Policy Directive to the Secretary of State

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs the Secretary of State to align U.S. foreign policy with the 'America First' approach, prioritizing American interests and citizens in all diplomatic and policy decisions. It requires the Department of State to adjust its policies, programs, personnel, and operations accordingly without altering existing legal authorities or budget procedures.
potential_concerns: The broad mandate to prioritize America First may lead to reduced cooperation with international partners, risking global alliances.
The order lacks detailed guidance, which could result in inconsistent implementation across the Department of State.
Prioritizing American interests in foreign policy may inadvertently harm U.S. credibility and influence abroad.
Emphasis on America First could reduce attention to humanitarian and multilateral commitments.
Potential conflicts may arise between this orderâ€™s priorities and existing treaty obligations or international agreements.
